claim: Americans drink more beer than Europeans.

supporting.text: According to per capita consumption data from the World Health Organization, several European countries (e.g., Czech Republic, Germany, Austria) have higher beer consumption than the United States.

attacks.text: According to per capita consumption data from the World Health Organization, several European countries (e.g., Czech Republic, Germany, Austria) have higher beer consumption than the United States.

The WHO data may not account for unrecorded or home-brewed beer consumption, which is more prevalent in some European countries.

supporting.text: The U.S. has a larger total population than any single European country, so in absolute terms, Americans may consume more beer than individual European nations.
